items.expectation: MAX DROP 175 RPM, MAX DIFF 50 RPM

items.prompt: Uniform rise of about 50 F in all EGTs in single magneto operation.
Do not allow a drop of more than 500 RPM. Cycle up to three times in cold weather.
Make sure power idle does not cause engine to quit.
Engine is warm for takeoff when throttle can be opened without engine faltering.
Uniform rise of EGTs with application of the mixture control.
Prior to Flight in Instrument Meteorological Conditions

If NO BATT is displayed on the G5 attitude indicator, or green battery status is not shown after pressing the power button on the G5 attitude indicator, do not fly in instrument meteorological conditions.
Runway number, base and final clear, wind conditions
Vx Best Angle: 68 gear down 87 gear up
Vy Best Rate: 87 gear down 92 gear up
Descent checklist: plan descent, enrichen mixture, switches as required, fuel tank as required.
On airspeed, on altitude. VFE is 109 KIAS.
Cutting engine power with open throttle may cause spark plugs to foul.
Set until chocked. Make certain brakes are released prior to towing.
Check for any items we need to address prior to the next operation.
Debris may cause dings that need to be serviced before the next flight.
Check for tire pressures, flat spots, nicks. Check brake pads. Check struts for leakage and extension.
Check for oil leaking out of the front end.
Look for oil leaks or other evidence of ground damage.
Did we leave a filler cap somewhere?
Store items. Turn off lights. Close and lock door.

items.expectation: FULL POWER PRIOR TO BRAKE RELEASE

items.prompt: Enter configuration mode by holding [ENT] and applying unit power. Allow Pilot To Edit Flt ID: Select YES to let the pilot change the flight ID.
Proceed with power off landing procedure.
If sufficient runway remains for a normal landing, leave gear down and land straight ahead.
If area ahead is rough, or if it is necessary to clear obstacles:
If sufficient altitude is gained to attempt a restart:
If power is not regained, prepare for power off landing.
If no fuel flow is indicated, check tank selector position to be sure it is on a tank containing fuel.
If power is not regained, prepare for power off landing.

checklists.title: Loss of Oil Pressure or High Oil Temperature

items.prompt: If equipped, before speed drops below 106 KIAS to prevent gear from free falling.
Touchdown should normally be made at the lowest possible airspeed with full flaps.
Reduce electrical load and land as soon as practical.
If battery is fully discharged, the gear will have to be lowered using the emergency gear extension procedure. Position lights will not illuminate.
Then set if any control is available
If landing gear does not check down and locked:
If landing gear still does not check down and locked:
If all electrical power has been lost, the landing gear must be extended using the above procedure.  The Gear position indicators will not illuminate.
To smoothly regain level flight attitude
If only upper latch is open:
If the airplane deviates unexpectedly from the planned flight path:
Be prepared for high stabilator control forces.

items.expectation: RE-TRIM if necessary using Stabilator Trim Wheel

items.prompt: Do not release the AP DISC / TRIM INT Button until after pulling the autopilot Circuit Breaker. Pulling the autopilot circuit breaker will render the autopilot, yaw damper (if installed), and ESP inoperative.

In flight, do not overpower the autopilot. The trim will operate in the direction opposing the overpower force, which will result in large out-of-trim forces. Do not attempt to re-engage the autopilot or use manual electric pitch trim until the cause of the malfunction has been corrected.
Landing with Electrical Failure - No Engine Monitor
High power settings or rapid changes
